pros: Small hospital friendly positive people

pros: Great rehab team that provides the best care as able in a subpar facility/ environment.
cons: Poor communication, no attempt at staff retention, below local market wages and PTO...sick time that can't be used unless 80hrs in your bank and no payout upon retirement/leaving. Inability to keep staff prior to COVID. 8 CEOs/ interim CEOs in the last 11 years.

pros: Great bonuses offered for extra shifts
cons: Mandatory OT, so overworked that even $40/hr +time and 1/2 still isn't worth it. Unsafe patient ratios for acuity level, only 1 hospitalist on duty at night, no night pharmacy, no techs, paper charts and care plans. Corporate demand a dog and pony show of their psychosocial patient centered care methods but won’t invest in the resources needed for the physiological needs.

pros: Always something different coming in
cons: Not well staffed, pay low for the area

pros: Nice people, small town feels like family
cons: Poor staffing. ICU skills required on tele floors with high ratios

review_title: Shore Point Health.  New name and logo, same Corporate policies.
job_title: Patient Financial Counselor in Venice, FL
pros: Overall day to day Staff is terrific
cons: Staff / Teams hands are tied by Corporate goals, policies and procedures. No support or training. Online training atching videos considered as their training model. For profit hospital that focuses on money and production. Little care for employees. Unreasonable workloads leave employees burned out. All departments understaffed. Hospital name and logo recently changed to Shore Point Health. Same corporate policies and procedures, different name and logo.

review_title: Uncaring,   Unfair pay,  No Communication, Over worked and take on more and more with no Salary Increase
job_title: Executive Administrative Assistant in Venice, FL
pros: Great people, Close to home,
cons: Unappreciated, longevity doesn't matter, they hire warm bodies instead of talent

pros: Many workers have been working there for a very long time. Great, positive staff, below management level. The remaining physicians are excellent in their area of expertise.
cons: Morale is poor. All the hourly staff are way overworked. Heard that an employee worked a 20 hour shift recently as there weren't enough staff to cover a critical role. Competition hospitals are vying to take over CON - Certificate of Need. I'm sure they would run the place to treat patients conditions rather than a write-off as a failing hospital under the parent organization, Community Health Systems (CHS) . Side note CHS stock has gone from over $70 to under $11 a share. CHS has at least 12 hospitals for sale and believe that is why they're not investing in this one. Their greed of clutching the CON will be detrimental to the citizens and visitors to the Venice area.

review_title: GCMG clinics. Profit before patient care.
pros: Decent benefit package. Office staff at most locations is friendly. Flexible schedules at certain locations. Not much else is positive about GCMG, Bayfront Health, or CHS.
cons: Too much focus on getting money out of the patients pocket and not enough focus on patient care. Office management has little to no management experience, most are previous RNs or office assistants. Practice managers are very arrogant and nasty. Zero training. Zero communication. No guidelines for clinic practices so employees never really know if they were doing their job right they only find out when they're doing it wrong. High turnover of employees, but that is to be expected when don't treat them well. Buildings are in disrepair and unclean. Offices are often understaffed and under supplied with materials, even medical necessities that are needed for a medical office to run properly

pros: Close to home for me.
cons: Benefits aren't that good (health insurance is awful, dental is too.) Not enough pay.  HR is not helpful in trying to figure out anything that has to do with transferring. I am trying to get back to RN school and they were very discouraging in finding another position that would suit my needs. I would actually make less as a CNA or a surgical serialization tech than an office assistant with no degree/certification. Not happy here, but have to pay bills and save for school somehow.

pros: Pay is average and some really good nurses
cons: Management is not truthful about job and their open door policy , horrible gossip, Super heavy workload.
